name: CreateGitReference
description:
Create a new reference in a GitHub repository.

Use this tool to create a new reference in a GitHub repository, such as a branch or a tag. Ensure the repository is not empty and contains at least one branch.

parameters.name: repository_owner
parameters.description: The account owner of the repository, not case sensitive.

value_schema.description: The account owner of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

parameters.name: repository_name
parameters.description: The case-insensitive name of the GitHub repository to create a reference in.

value_schema.description: The name of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

parameters.name: full_reference_name
parameters.description: The fully qualified reference name (e.g., 'refs/heads/master'). Must start with 'refs' and include at least two slashes.

value_schema.description: The name of the fully qualified reference (ie: `refs/heads/master`). If it doesn't start with 'refs' and have at least two slashes, it will be rejected.

parameters.name: reference_sha
parameters.description: The SHA-1 value for the reference. Required for creating a new reference in the repository.

value_schema.description: The SHA1 value for this reference.

parameters.name: authentication_token
parameters.description: The GitHub authentication token required to authorize the API request.
